title: A Norwegian Battery Maker Is Moving To The U.S. To Tap Federal Incentives
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project, named Giga America, is located in Coweta County, Georgia, southwest of Atlanta, United States.

Capacity:
- The Georgia plant is planned to have the capacity to produce 34-gigawatt hours of batteries annually when it opens in a few years.

Investment amounts:
- The company is building a $2.5 billion battery plant in Georgia.

Project progress:
- Freyr is currently building the Giga America battery plant in Georgia, with plans to open in a few years. The company has also opened a small-scale factory line in Mo I Rana, Norway, earlier this year.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as Freyr is currently constructing the Giga America battery plant in Georgia.

Value chain stages:
- The facility is planned to cover cell fabrication, as it will produce cells for use in stationary energy storage systems, electric vehicles, and marine products.

Note: The information provided does not cover details about subsidies or specific investment amounts beyond the total project cost.

title: FREYR Battery Provides Operations Update
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Mo i Rana, Norway, where FREYR's Customer Qualification Plant (CQP) is in service for technology development.

Capacity:
- No specific capacity information is provided in the given text.

Investment amounts:
- No specific investment amounts or subsidies information is provided in the given text.

Project progress:
- The project has achieved an important interim technical milestone by successfully conducting automated cathode casting trials at the CQP in Mo i Rana, Norway.
- The company has completed handovers of 88% of the discrete production line equipment commissioning and testing packages at the CQP.
- The next technical requirements include replicating the successful automated cathode casting trials with the anode production line system and integrating the casting webs across the cathode, anode, and merge units of the Casting and Unit Cell Assembly equipment.

Project type:
- The project involves the development of clean, next-generation battery cell production capacity at the Customer Qualification Plant (CQP) in Mo i Rana, Norway.

Value chain stages:
- The text does not provide specific information about the value chain stages covered at the facility.

title: FREYR Battery Sanctions Construction of its Inaugural Gigafactory
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Mo i Rana, Norway.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the Giga Arctic project is 29 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- The identified debt financing support for the project is over $1.6 billion, with indications of up to EUR 400 million in loans and/or guarantees from Norway’s Export Credit Agency Eksfin.
- The total capital cost for the expanded Giga Arctic project is estimated to be $1.7 billion.

Project progress:
- The Board of Directors has sanctioned the construction of Giga Arctic, the company’s first battery manufacturing facility under development.
- The project is expected to start production in the first half of 2024.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the construction of Giga Arctic being approved by the Board of Directors.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly.

Note: The information provided is based on the data extracted from the articles.
